page.title: 03 Bury General Hospital
page.content:
The hospital was opened in 1882 but not in its present form, more like a pharmacy. The newest section of the hospital is the records section, built just outside casualty. The oldest sections are the private wards, William Street ward and the board room which was once a chapel for the{dead.
There is a new{body scanner}which has just been bought by public subscription. There are on average 20 operations a day in the two theatres. The{NHS}wards have 33 beds each while the{private}wards have 12 single rooms per ward.
There are around 800 people employed in the hospital. The nursing school round the corner has been open 19 years and takes 50 students per year.
